dt: {bc}an electronic communications network that connects computer networks and organizational computer facilities around the world
used with {it}the{/it} except when being used attributively

In U.S. publications, the capitalized form {it}Internet{/it} continues to be more common than {it}internet{/it}, although the lowercase form is rapidly gaining more widespread use. In British publications, {it}internet{/it} is now the more common form.

shortdef: an electronic communications network that connects computer networks and organizational computer facilities around the world —used with the except when being used attributively

dt: {bc}the networking capability that allows information to be sent to and received from objects and devices (such as fixtures and kitchen appliances) using the Internet

dt.t: The {wi}Internet of Things{/wi} really comes together with the connection of sensors and machines. That is to say, the real value that the {wi}Internet of Things{/wi} creates is at the intersection of gathering data and leveraging it. All the information gathered by all the sensors in the world isn't worth very much if there isn't an infrastructure in place to analyze it in real time.

Extend the … example to the {wi}Internet of Things{/wi}, where any interaction with a connected object has the potential of teaching something new to every connected object, and the immense scaling of networked machine learning becomes almost unimaginable.

As many as 50 billion devices will be online by the end of the decade. Along with smart thermostats and appliances, this so-called {wi}Internet of Things{/wi} (IoT) includes swaths of tiny sensors that track everything from steps and calories to humidity and light.

shortdef: the networking capability that allows information to be sent to and received from objects and devices (such as fixtures and kitchen appliances) using the Internet —abbreviation IoT

dt: {bc}a company that provides its customers with access to the Internet and that may also provide other Internet-related services (such as email accounts)

shortdef: a company that provides its customers with access to the Internet and that may also provide other Internet-related services (such as email accounts) —abbreviation ISP—called also access provider

dt: {bc}any of various technologies that support telephony using the Internet for transmission rather than traditional phone lines

dt.t: … you might be ready for {wi}Voice over Internet Protocol{/wi} (VoIP) service, which lets you make telephone calls over the Net to any phone in the world.

shortdef: any of various technologies that support telephony using the Internet for transmission rather than traditional phone lines —abbreviation VoIP

dt: {bc}a system that connects computers throughout the world

shortdef: a system that connects computers throughout the world
